Surfaceclass

objects.t[5124], en_us.t[2097]

Superclass
Tree

Subclass
Tree

Global
Objects

Property
Summary

Method
Summary

Property
Details

Method
Details

Surface: an object that can have other objects placed on top of it. A surface is essentially the same as a regular container, but the contents of a surface behave as though they are on the surface’s top rather than contained within the object.

Modified in en_us.t[2097]:
Language modifications for the specialized container types

class Surface :   BulkLimiter

lookInDesc

objects.t[5131]

Our fixed LOOK IN description. This is shown in response to LOOK IN before we list our portable contents; it can be used to show generally what the surface looks like. By default, we say nothing here.

objInPrepOVERRIDDEN

en_us.t[2102]

takeFromNotInMessageOVERRIDDEN

objects.t[5143]

we’re a surface, so taking something from me that’s not among my contents shows the message as “that’s not on the iobj”

dobjFor(LookIn)OVERRIDDEN

objects.t[5188]

Looking “in” a surface simply shows the surface’s contents.

tryMovingObjInto (obj)OVERRIDDEN

objects.t[5161]

Try moving an object into this container. For a surface, this performs a PUT ON command to move the object onto self. TADS 3 Library Manual
